Notes: This parameter is special since it is not dfined for non-VB devices - assuming bridge mode
In MTLK open=1; wep=2; personal=3; enterprise=4; based on encrType (in MAPI 0=open; 1=WEP; 2=TKIP; 3=AES;  =TKIP_AES) and authType (2=RADIUS; 3=PSK)

open=1; restricted=2; auto=3. This param is  relevant for WEP and defines wchich connections will be respected; auto means agree for what is suggested. open-restricted type (auto) is not  mentioned in Driver API doc

open=1; restricted=2; auto=3. This param is  relevant for WEP and defines wchich connections will be respected; auto means agree for what is suggested. open-restricted type (auto) is not  mentioned in Driver API doc

WPA=1; WPA2=2; mixed=3; mixed restricted=4(not allowed WPA+CCMP or WPA2+TKIP). Since mode 4 is buggy - despite the fact mode 3 is illegal - we are not ommiting mode 3. Requested only when security_mode=3 To recheck in WPS - possible bug there

WPA=1; WPA2=2; mixed=3; mixed restricted=4(not allowed WPA+CCMP or WPA2+TKIP). Since mode 4 is buggy - despite the fact mode 3 is illegal - we are not ommiting mode 3. Requested only when security_mode=3 To recheck in WPS - possible bug there

Conversion_Func_-_Get: pskFlag=0 => return passPhrase else return psk
Conversion_Func_-_Set: input len=64 => pskFlag=1;update psk else pskFlag=0 update passPhrase
Notes: In mtlk old code; every time hostapd.conf is created we check this param and if it's 64 bytes long; it is psk; otherwise it is passphrase. Make sure to update correct wlpsk<1> or <2> according to wlan<no.>;make sure wlan_psk_Count is at least what you are about to update
In MTLK: TKIP=0; CCMP=1; BOTH=2 Requested only when security_mode=4
In MTLK: TKIP=0; CCMP=1; BOTH=2. Requested only when security_mode=3
Make sure to update correct wl1x_<0> or wl1x_<1> according to wlan<no.>;make sure  wlan_1x_Count is at least what you are about to update
Make sure to update correct wlwps<1>_0 or  wlwps<2>_0 according to wlan<no.>;make sure wlan_wps_Count is at least what you are about to update
rc.conf: Following line must be defined in capabilites: powerLvl=”12;25;50;100” Power-Level-12% : -9 Power-Level-25% : -6 Power-Level-50% : -3 Power-Level-100% : 0 PowerSelection is not in Driver doc
In MTLK: 0=DISABLE 1=ALLOW 2=DENY; in UGW: Allow=0 1=Deny and 2=Disable
Return as value for maxClientsPer VAP in wlan_capability script

Conversion_Func_-_Get: If ACL enabled read wlan_mac_control_Count to know how manyMACs are defined; read all MACs; and make one string
Conversion_Func_-_Set: Split string to many params Update wlan_mac_control_Count
Notes: UGW saves each MAC in diff param. Example : #<< wlan_mac_control wlan_mac_control_Count="3" wlmacctrl_0_cpeId="1" wlmacctrl_0_pcpeId="1" wlmacctrl_0_macAddr="aa:bb:cc:11:22:33" wlmacctrl_1_cpeId="2" wlmacctrl_1_pcpeId="1" wlmacctrl_1_macAddr="a1:b2:c3:d4:e5:f6" wlmacctrl_2_cpeId="3" wlmacctrl_2_pcpeId="3" wlmacctrl_2_macAddr="a6:b5:c4:d3:e2:f1" #>>  wlan_mac_control
AlgoCalibrMask is not in Driver doc
OnlineACM is not in Driver doc
In UGW: 0=Disabled;1=1 Spatial Stream 2=1 or 2 Spatial Streams;3=1 2 or 3 Spatial Streams STBC is not in Driver doc
In UGW: 0=400nsec; 1=800nsec; 2=auto. In MTLK 1(enable) =400nsec; 0(disable)=800nsec. ShortCyclcPrfx is not in Driver doc
In MTLK: 0=20MHz; 1=40MHz; 2=auto. In UGW: 0=20MHz; 2=40MHz; 1=auto. Wrong values explanation in the Driver doc

Conversion_Func_-_Get: In case of 5G figure out according to channel number - if channel is mult of 8 return upper otherwise return lower
Notes: Uppr=0 Lower=1;AocsBonding is missing in Driver doc
AdvancedCoding is missing in Driver doc
0=ADVERTISE; 1=HIDDEN. HiddenSSID is missing in Driver doc
ShortSlotTime is missing in Driver doc
In UGW None=0;Short=1;Long=2;Auto=3. ShortPreamble is missing in Driver doc
BSSProtection is missing in Driver doc
No need to make sure wlan_wep_Count is at least the interface you are updating + 1 since it is ignored according to the UGW wlan document
UGW use encrType for WEP and other sec modes
In MTLK:0=5;1=2.4;2=both. In UGW: 0=2.4 GHz;1=5 GHz;2=Dual Freq;3=Concurrent Dual Freq

Conversion_Func_-_Set: if Channel=0 then set autoChanEna=1 else set channelNo

Notes: In UGW there is one set of parameters for all Acs. nAMPDUena defines if the aggregation enabled (?); nAMPDUdir defines the direction: 1=use;2=use and accept; nAMPDUfrms is max number of frames; nBAWsize that is block aknowledge (aggregation?) window size and there are several parameters that define A-MSDU aggregation. Since these are not helpfull (or do they?); we define our own params. To keep investigating.

Conversion_Func_-_Get: Channel is fixed - AOCS is always disabled; channel is auto - read AOCS enabled from the proper parameter
1->2; else 0; if not present check wlan_main apType: 0->2; 1->3;2->0;4->0
Conversion_Func_-_Set: 2->1; else 0; if not present update wlan_main apType: 0->2; 2->0;3->1

Notes: In UGW when 'setupLock' set to True new registrar can not be added - is it our case? not sure what it means recheck
Param definition is not synchronised with Driver doc
UGW has param grpKeyEna that must be set to 1 (default is 0)
In MTLK: 24G 0=default set; 1=All; 2=1-2 Mbps; 52G 0=default; 1=All - to verify what is included UGW has comma separated list: wlmn_0_basicDataRate="1.0;5.5;11.0"
Param definition in Driver doc uses word "forced" and not "fixed"
Param definition in Driver doc uses word "forced" and not "fixed". There is difference in values between WEB and tables in the document.
In MTLK: DHCP=0 static=1; In UGW the opposite

Conversion_Func_-_Set: count min of set value and CONFIG_FEATURE_IFX_CONCURRENT_DUAL_WIRELESS and store
